Wisdom: السَّخَاءُ مَا كَانَ ابْتِدَاءً فَإِنْ كَانَ عَنْ مَسْأَلَةٍ فَحَيَاءٌ وَتَذَمُّمٌ
enWisdom: Generosity is that which one gives [himself], for if he gives after being asked, then it is [a result of] shame and embarrassment

Wisdom: ابْدَأِ السَّائِلَ بِالنَّوَالِ قَبْلَ السُّؤَالِ فَإِنَّكَ إِنْ أَحْوَجْتَهُ إِلَى سُؤَالِكَ أَخَذْتَ مِنْ حُرِّ وَجْهِهِ أَفْضَلَ مِمَّا أَعْطَيْتَهُ
enWisdom: Give the beggar before he asks, for indeed if you make it necessary for him to ask, then you will have taken from his dignity that which is greater than what you have given him
The most pleasing kindness is offering [something] without being asked [for it]

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ الْعَطِيَّةِ مَا كَانَ قَبْلَ مَذَلَّةِ السُّؤَالِ
enWisdom: The best grant is that which is [bestowed] before the humility of having to ask [for it]

Wisdom: خَيْرُ الْعَطَاءِ مَا كَانَ عَنْ غَيْرِ طَلَبٍ
enWisdom: The best grant is that which is [given] without being sought
The pinnacle of generosity is being expeditious in giving

Wisdom: مِنْ أَكْمَلِ الْإِفْضَالِ بَذْلُ النَّوَالِ قَبْلَ السُّؤَالِ
enWisdom: One who perfects his kindness gives generously before he is asked

Wisdom: مَنْ بَذَلَ النَّوَالَ قَبْلَ السُّؤَالِ فَهُوَ الْكَرِيمُ الْمَحْبُوبُ
enWisdom: One who grants generously before being asked, then he is truly honourable and much-loved

Wisdom: مَنْ بَدَأَ بِالْعَطِيَّةِ مِنْ غَيْرِ طَلَبٍ وَأَكْمَلَ الْمَعْرُوفَ مِنْ غَيْرِ امْتِنَانٍ فَقَدْ أَكْمَلَ الْإِحْسَانَ
enWisdom: One who begins giving without being asked and completes good deeds without any obligation has perfected his favour

Wisdom: لَا يَسْتَحِقُّ اسْمَ الْكَرَمِ إِلَّا مَنْ بَدَأَ بِنَوَالِهِ قَبْلَ سُؤَالِهِ
enWisdom: None deserves to be called munificent except the one who gives before he is asked
